comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: LOC: note transcription error on caption, per Kilted Cowboy. Also, the picture is pretty clearly labeled and displayed upside-down. The inscriptions on the gauge faces are all upside-down and the speaking tube and lights make no sense in this direction. I think you should invert it for display in the Commons. ... This appears to be the USS G-3, formerly the Turbot. See notes under Wikipedia entry: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_G-3_(SS-31)

comment.author: 83025347@N00
comment._content: Also the inclinometer would not be much use in that orientation.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks artolog.  We've fixed the orientation.

comment.author: 35075914@N06
comment._content: And the "charges" will be "gauges" next time records are updated.  Thanks for the catch.
